instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V No USB activity
threads.message:
All main rails are present 

<SIGNAL>PP1V1_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL> are all shorted to gnd measuring 0 or 1 Ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V No USB activity
threads.message:
Looks like shorted CPU.
The readings should be around 0.007 in diode mode there.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
